title: Querieez
author: Querieez
content: Is there a website that shows a chart of the prices of 2 or more currencies over time in USD?I'd like to compare the price of Bitcoin vs USD vs another cryptocurrency to see if there's any other cause and effect.May be important for investing in cryptos.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: April 10, 2023, 07:51:09 PMLast edit: April 10, 2023, 08:54:15 PM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Querieez on April 10, 2023, 07:45:37 PMMay be important for investing in cryptos.It is better you use any exchange of your choice to pin or star the coins that you like, paired with USD. You can compare the coin pairs individually. What you do is to view more than 1 chart, like up to 4 at once on some exchanges  which you can use to be viewing the price of 2 or more coins at a time. As for my preference, I prefer 1 chart. And this is used by traders instead of investors. Viewing chart is easier for holders. Do not make things complicated for yourself.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: If I understood you correctly, then CoinMarketCap should do what you're looking for.  Let's say you want to compare BTC with ETH:1. Go to Bitcoin's page: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/2. Just above the chart, you will see a "compare with" text field, select Ethereum (or any other coin).3. That's it. The chart should now show you both prices.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Charting tools like tradingview and coinalyze.net also have similar options to compare prizes of different coins, but they instead the chart to percentages and not actual USD  price to fit the two graphs in one chart.Otherwise, BTC price would be way off the ETH price because of the different price rangesJust click on compare

comments.body: Here are the websites that you can choose from, besides, others were already given above.https://coinmarketcap.com/https://www.tradingview.com/https://www.coingecko.com/https://www.coinbase.com/chartsJust choose which is best for you and have the option to compare individual coin pairs.What I like most is Tradingview because it has a lot of tools and features that you can use while comparing prices or having price analysis in trading.

comments.author: Myleschetty
comments.body: I can see that you have been provided with the needed answer and Coinmarketcap is the only site I can recommend. With that being said. Why would you compare Bitcoin with other altcoins when you can invest mainly in Bitcoin to secure your investment since the current market trend is determined by the price momentum Bitcoin displays in the market?

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: In trading view, with free account, you can compare two cryptocurrencies on a same chart.With free account, you will have limited parameters at the same time on your chart but honestly from my experience, you don't need to have too many parameters on your chart at the same time. It only makes your chart more complicated and unnecessary messy.Simple is best for your trading view with TradingView.
